channel.title: TORONTO STAR

item.title: N.S. man, 22, facing impaired driving charges after fatal collision in Glencoe
item.author: The Canadian Press
item.description: Inverness RCMP say they were called to the scene on Saturday evening after a jeep struck a bank and rolled. A 19-year-old man from Whycocomagh was pronounced dead.

media:content.media:title: N.S. man, 22, facing impaired driving charges after fatal collision in Glencoe
media:content.media:description: A 22-year-old man from Whycocomagh, N.S., is facing charges of impaired operation of a conveyance causing death and impaired operation of a conveyance causing bodily harm.

item.title: ‘We are here together, awake’: Hundreds gather for Halifax Pride march, candlelight vigil
item.author: Noushin Ziafati - Local Journalism Initiative Reporter, The Chronicle Herald
item.description: Hosted as part of a series of Halifax Pride 2020 events, the march calling for an end to systemic racism and police brutality kicked off at Victoria Park, against the backdrop of the Black Lives Matter movement.

media:content.media:title: ‘We are here together, awake’: Hundreds gather for Halifax Pride march, candlelight vigil
media:content.media:description: Hosted as part of a series of Halifax Pride 2020 events, a couple hundred people gathered in downtown Halifax Monday evening to elevate, celebrate and mourn the loss of queer and trans Black, Indigenous and other people of colour.

item.title: Cornwallis statue, park and street need to go, Halifax task force says
item.author: The Canadian Press
item.description: In its report published today, the task force is recommending that the Halifax Regional Council rename a park and street honouring Cornwallis, as well as take down his statue.

media:content.media:title: Cornwallis statue, park and street need to go, Halifax task force says
media:content.media:description: The city had temporarily removed the Cornwallis statue from the downtown park that bears his name in January 2018, pending a review of the task force, a joint initiative of regional council and the Assembly of Nova Scotia Mi’kmaq Chiefs.

item.title: At least 17 people dead after ‘incomprehensible’ shooting in Nova Scotia
item.author: Ilya Bañares - Staff Reporter,Ted Fraser - Staff Reporter,Steve McKinley - Halifax Bureau,Ilya Banares - Staff Reporter
item.description: Const. Heidi Stevenson, a 23-year veteran of the RCMP, was killed and a second officer wounded. Suspected gunman Gabriel Wortman, 51, was also among the dead.

media:content.media:title: At least 17 people dead after ‘incomprehensible’ shooting in Nova Scotia
media:content.media:description: RCMP officers close the road off near the scene of one of the victims of a shooting spree in Debert, Nova Scotia.

media:content.media:title: At least 17 people dead after ‘incomprehensible’ shooting in Nova Scotia
media:content.media:description: Photos from scene of reported arrest of active shooter at Irving Big Stop where Hwy 102 crosses Hwy 2, near Enfield N.S.

media:content.media:title: At least 17 people dead after ‘incomprehensible’ shooting in Nova Scotia
media:content.media:description: A message of sympathy at the top of Portapique Beach Road where suspect Gabriel Wortman is reported to have lived in Portapique, Nova Scotia.

media:content.media:title: At least 17 people dead after ‘incomprehensible’ shooting in Nova Scotia
media:content.media:description: RCMP blockade Portapique Beach Road where suspect is reported to have lived in Portapique, NS.

media:content.media:title: At least 17 people dead after ‘incomprehensible’ shooting in Nova Scotia
media:content.media:description: RCMP in Nova Scotia tweeted out this photo said to be the vehicle suspected gunman Gabriel Wortman had been driving, at least at one point — made to resemble an RCMP car save for the number "28B11" on its side.

media:content.media:title: At least 17 people dead after ‘incomprehensible’ shooting in Nova Scotia
media:content.media:description: RCMP say more than 10 people are dead after a police chase in rural Nova Scotia including Const. Heidi Stevenson.

item.title: New Brunswick declares emergency, orders most public-facing companies closed
item.author: Keith Doucette - The Canadian Press,Giuseppe Valiante
item.description: New Brunswick premier Blaine Higgs says his directives are no longer suggestions and all citizens, under law, must comply.

media:content.media:title: New Brunswick declares emergency, orders most public-facing companies closed
media:content.media:description: To date, Nova Scotia has 1,373 negative test results as a result of daily testing.
media:content.media:credit: Centers for Disease Control and AFP via Getty Images file

item.title: Lawyer for Nova Scotia officer charged with theft applies to mental health court
item.author: Michael MacDonald - The Canadian Press
item.description: Lawyer James Giacomantonio said his client suffers from mental illnesses, including post-traumatic stress disorder, related to her work as a veteran officer.

media:content.media:title: Lawyer for Nova Scotia officer charged with theft applies to mental health court
media:content.media:description: Const. Jennifer McPhee, who has over 17 years of service with Halifax Regional Police, remains suspended with pay.

item.title: Bomb threat forces 1,300 bar patrons into the cold in downtown Halifax
item.author: The Canadian Press
item.description: Municipal buses were brought in to provide temporary shelter for those who could not leave because they didn’t have access to money or keys to their homes.

media:content.media:title: Bomb threat forces 1,300 bar patrons into the cold in downtown Halifax
media:content.media:description: Halifax police say the threat against the Liquor Dome on Argyle Street was reported at 12:50 a.m. overnight on Saturday.

item.title: Halifax police issue warning after potent synthetic opioid found in search
item.author: The Canadian Press
item.description: Police say they searched a home on Dentith Road on Feb. 12 and turned up about 1,900 pills that couldn’t be identified.

media:content.media:title: Halifax police issue warning after potent synthetic opioid found in search
media:content.media:description: Police warn that given the drug’s potency, a user may need several doses of naloxone to counter an overdose. They are urging anyone who consumes it to seek immediate medical assistance.

item.title: Minor tremor shakes Dartmouth area prompting several 911 calls to police
item.author: The Canadian Press
item.description: Police received confirmation from a seismologist with Earthquakes Canada that there was an earthquake-like event that registered at 2.6 on the Richter scale.

media:content.media:title: Minor tremor shakes Dartmouth area prompting several 911 calls to police
media:content.media:description: A pedestrian crosses Portland St. in snowy downtown Dartmouth on Friday, Dec. 28, 2018.

item.title: Man charged with impaired driving after vehicle smashes into Halifax home
item.author: The Canadian Press
item.description: Police say the car also almost struck a pedestrian as it drove away from the scene of the incident, but there were no injuries.

media:content.media:title: Man charged with impaired driving after vehicle smashes into Halifax home
media:content.media:description: No injuries were reported after a car struck a house in a Halifax suburb and a suspect fled the scene late Friday.

item.title: Nova Scotia to regulate nicotine levels in e-cigarettes in proposed legislation
item.author: The Canadian Press

media:content.media:title: Nova Scotia to regulate nicotine levels in e-cigarettes in proposed legislation
media:content.media:description: Nova Scotia's ban on flavoured e-cigarettes takes effect April 1.

item.title: Halifax couple thanks public a year after house fire claimed their 7 children
item.author: The Canadian Press
item.description: The Barhos said they had managed to find comfort in the kindness of strangers, the courage of first responders and in the dedication of health-care professionals.

media:content.media:title: Halifax couple thanks public a year after house fire claimed their 7 children
media:content.media:description: Syrian refugees Ebraheim and Kawthar Barho survived the fire that destroyed their rental home in the Halifax suburb of Spryfield on Feb. 19, 2019.

item.title: Nova Scotia man dies after snowmobile and pickup truck collide
item.author: The Canadian Press
item.description: The RCMP say the 60-year-old man from Canaan died at the scene of the collision in Aylesford on Friday evening.

media:content.media:title: Nova Scotia man dies after snowmobile and pickup truck collide
media:content.media:description: The RCMP say they are investigating the cause of the crash Friday evening that killed a 60-year-old man from Canaan, N.S.

item.title: Nova Scotia man dies in collision between pickup truck and tractor-trailer
item.author: The Canadian Press
item.description: The crash occurred Wednesday on Highway 103 between Exits 18 and 19 near Brooklyn, N.S.

media:content.media:title: Nova Scotia man dies in collision between pickup truck and tractor-trailer
media:content.media:description: Police say their initial investigation determined the pickup crossed the centre line and collided with the tractor-trailer.

item.title: Stephen McNeil says talks ongoing with Northern Pulp mill over millions in outstanding loans
item.author: Keith Doucette - The Canadian Press
item.description: A spokesman from McNeil’s office confirmed Thursday the outstanding total is roughly $84.9-million.

media:content.media:title: Stephen McNeil says talks ongoing with Northern Pulp mill over millions in outstanding loans
media:content.media:description: Nova Scotia Premier Stephen McNeil makes an announcement regarding the Northern Pulp mill in Halifax, Friday, Friday, Dec 20, 2019.

item.title: Forecast for Atlantic Canada calling for rain, freezing rain, snow, ice pellets
item.author: The Canadian Press
item.description: Environment Canada has issued scores of special weather statements and warnings to all four provinces as a storm approaches.

media:content.media:title: Forecast for Atlantic Canada calling for rain, freezing rain, snow, ice pellets
media:content.media:description: A man walks down the middle of New Gower St. in St. John’s on Friday, Jan. 17. Up to 15 centimetres of snow and ice pellets are in the forecast Friday for the northern Avalon Peninsula in eastern Newfoundland, where a punishing storm last month kept St. John’s shut down for an entire week.

item.title: Nova Scotia names lawyer as privacy and freedom of information watchdog
item.author: The Canadian Press
item.description: The new appointment of Tricia Ralph, who is currently legal counsel for the information and privacy commissioner of Nunavut and the Northwest Territories, takes effect on March 1.

media:content.media:title: Nova Scotia names lawyer as privacy and freedom of information watchdog
media:content.media:description: Tricia Ralph, who is currently legal counsel for the information and privacy commissioner of Nunavut and the Northwest Territories, has been appointed the new freedom of information officer for Nova Scotia.

item.title: Atlantic ice conditions lighter to date but expected to grow, according to Coast Guard
item.author: Keith Doucette - The Canadian Press
item.description: The superintendent of ice operations for the Atlantic region says milder weather in December has resulted in a slow start to ice formation, although the Coast Guard is expecting a significant workload as temperatures drop.

media:content.media:title: Atlantic ice conditions lighter to date but expected to grow, according to Coast Guard
media:content.media:description: The CCGS Captain Molly Kool is presented to the media after undergoing refit and conversion work at the Davie shipyard, Dec.14, 2018 in Levis Que. The Canadian Coast Guard says ice conditions so far this year in the Atlantic region are a little less heavy than at this point last year, although the next few weeks will determine the overall severity of the season.

item.title: Man threatened during ‘first date’ in Halifax-area park, police say
item.author: The Canadian Press
item.description: A man was allegedly lured into a Dartmouth park to meet a woman when another man appeared demanding his wallet and phone. The victim fled.

media:content.media:title: Man threatened during ‘first date’ in Halifax-area park, police say
media:content.media:description: Police say a 20-year-old female and a 21-year-old male are facing robbery charges after Saturday evening’s incident in a Dartmouth park.

item.title: Ex-soldier Desmond shot wife, mother and daughter from close range before killing himself, inquiry hears
item.author: The Canadian Press
item.description: A forensic pathologist has testified that Afghanistan war veteran Lionel Desmond shot his wife, daughter and mother from about one metre away in 2017 before firing a bullet into his own forehead.

media:content.media:title: Ex-soldier Desmond shot wife, mother and daughter from close range before killing himself, inquiry hears
media:content.media:description: A forensic pathologist has testified that Afghanistan war veteran Lionel Desmond shot his wife, daughter and mother from around one metre away in 2017 before firing a bullet into his own forehead.
